importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the news announcement regarding Doug Martin's death, indicating the timing of the public revelation of his passing.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Doug Martin played in the NFL, from his draft in 2012 through the end of his career in 2018, highlighting his active years and professional impact.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died at the age of 36.
Martin was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after playing at Boise State.
He rushed for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns in his NFL career across six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin was a Pro Bowl selection in 2015 and earned first-team All-Pro honors that year.
He also had 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers honored him as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration.
The cause of death has not been confirmed, and the family has requested privacy during the mourning period.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft after a standout college career at Boise State, Martin played for the Buccaneers for six seasons and one with the Raiders, accumulating 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns. He earned Pro Bowl honors in both his rookie season and 2015, and was named first-team All-Pro in 2015. The Buccaneers recognized him as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th-anniversary celebration. The cause of his death remains unconfirmed, and his family has requested privacy during this time.
title: Former Buccaneers All-Pro Running Back Doug Martin Dies at 36
